preflabel: Dissolved amino acid concentrations in the water column
definition: Parameters quantifying the amount of organic compounds containing both a carboxyl group and an amino group dissolved in a body of water.
Parameters used to encode information specifying access rights to data, usually in terms of authorised roles
Parameters quantifying the upward and downward motion of objects mounting sensors or collecting samples.
Parameters quantifying the amount of organic compounds containing both a carboxyl group and an amino group in unlithified seabed material.

preflabel: Particulate amino acid concentrations in the water column
definition: Parameters quantifying the amount of organic compounds containing both a carboxyl group and an amino group in solids suspended in a body of water.
The identity of the parameter is not declared.  Covers cases such as internal working parameters and dummy channels.
Concentration of any chemical species in water collected from the atmosphere.  Includes rain, snow, hail and fog but excludes cloud samples or snow accumulations on the ground.

preflabel: Macroalgae and seagrass infection and damage
definition: Parameters relating to diseases and parasites of macroalgae (Rhodophycota, Chromphycota, Chlorophycota)  and seagrass (Charophyta, Anthophyta) and damage to seagrass beds

preflabel: Concentrations of carboxylic acids and carboxylates in the atmosphere
definition: Parameters quantifying the concentration of acids containing a carboxyl (-C(=O)OH) group, their anions or their salts in any phase of the atmosphere
Parameters quantifying and describing the release of substances into the atmosphere as a result of human activity

preflabel: Concentration of other organic contaminants in the atmosphere
definition: Parameters quantifying concentrations of organic contaminants (substances regarded as harmful) other than PCBs and PAHs in all phases of the atmosphere

preflabel: Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in the atmosphere
definition: Parameters quantifying polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon (PAH) concentrations in all phases of the atmosphere

preflabel: Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in the atmosphere
definition: Parameters quantifying polychlorobiphenyl (PCB) concentrations in all phases of the atmosphere
Parameters describing the effects of substances on living organisms.
Parameters describing the actions or reactions of birds (Class Aves), usually in response to the environment. Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.
Parameters related to the reproduction of birds (Class Aves)
Parameters quantifying the capture of non-target species during commercial and non-commercial fishing trips
Parameters related to the reproduction of cetaceans (Order Cetacea)

preflabel: Contaminant fluxes between the terrestrial and marine environment
definition: Parameters quanitifying the transfer of substances considered harmful from land to sea, including river discharge rates of contaminant species (but not freshwater discharge rates).

Parameters describing the actions or reactions of fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chondrichthyes), usually in response to the environment. Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.
Parameters related to the infection of Fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes) by parasites and disease. Includes visual assesements and analytical data.
Parameters describing the extent, intensity, timing and method of fisheries
Parameters that quantify the level of industrial activity or industrial output
Parameters that quantify and specify material output into the environment as a result of industrial activity
Parameters quantifying the accidental spillage of liquid or dry pollutants from vessels or marine industries. Parameters may include quantities of pollutant, areas affected and event duration.
Parameters related to the abundance of reptiles (Class Reptilia)
Parameters relating to diseases and parasites of reptiles (Class Reptilia)
Parameters related to the reproduction of reptiles (Class Reptilia)
Parameters quantifying the level of activity moving people or cargo from one place to another.
Zooplankton (mesozooplankton and larger, exclusing fish, mammals, reptiles and insects) biomass determined by weighing unprocessed catch samples.

preflabel: Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in suspended particulate material
definition: PAH concentrations in suspended particulate material, regarded as anything sampled by a water bottle, SAP, sediment trap etc.  This group is for SPM composition measurements (concentration per unit weight) and NOT concentrations per unit volume of the water column in the particulate phase.

preflabel: Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in suspended particulate material
definition: PCB concentrations in suspended particulate material, regarded as anything sampled by a water bottle, SAP, sediment trap etc.  This group is for SPM composition measurements (concentration per unit weight) and NOT concentrations per unit volume of the water column in the particulate phase.

preflabel: Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in the water column
definition: PAH concentrations in all phases of the water column. This group includes concentrations per unit volume of the water column in the particulate phase, but not concentrations per unit wieght of SPM.

preflabel: Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in the water column
definition: PCB concentrations in all phases of the water column. This group excludes SPM composition measurements (concentration per unit weight).

preflabel: Sedimentation flux of carbon, nitrogen or organic matter in the water column
definition: Fluxes of particulate total, organic and inorganic carbon (including as CaCO3) and nitrogen (often measured as 'total' but assumed to be 'organic'). Organic matter is defined as matter lost on ignition.

preflabel: Fish non taxonomy-related abundance per unit volume of the water column
definition: Fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes) abundance per unit volume parameters not included under FATX.  Most commonly used for the generic term 'fish' that maps to multiple taxa.
Fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes) size and shape parameters not included under FATM.  Most commonly used for the generic term 'fish' that maps to multiple taxa.

preflabel: Nitrate+nitrite concentration parameters in the water column
definition: Deprecated term from a misguided attempt to distinguish between NO3 and NO3+NO2 for discovery. Use parameter group NTRA instead
Parameters quantifying the volume, mass or thickness of particulate material that gathers on the seabed per unit time.
Parameters quantifying the irradiance of the sun impinging on the Earth's surface in the visible and infra-red waveband, generally accepted as wavelengths between 300 and 3000 nm
Parameters quantifying the degree of hotness of the atmosphere.  Specifically excludes indirect measurements of other parameters such as wet bulb temperatures.

Includes all parameters covering the strength of electromagnetic radiation signal return, including absolute measurements of returning signal strength as well as parameters expressed as backscatter (the proportion of transmitted signal returned)

preflabel: Metal concentrations in suspended particulate material
definition: Concentrations of metal elements in suspended particulate material collected by water column filtration, centrifugation or sediment trapping. Deprecated as semantic overlap with MTWP.

preflabel: Particulate metal concentrations in the water column
definition: Concentration parameters for metallic elements in the particulate phase of the water column collected by fitration, centrifugation or sediment trapping
Concentration parameters for metallic elements in ice and snow
Concentration of metal elements in any phase of the atmosphere

preflabel: Alkalinity, acidity and pH of the water column
definition: Parameters quantifying the hydrogen ion concentration in water bodies
Parameters quantifying the amount of liquids (e.g. ship's ballast) or solids (e.g. dredge spoil) deposited into the water column as a result of man's activities

Parameterisations that describe climatic conditions in the past.  Includes climate indices, climate indicators and indirect measurements of climate-related phenomena such as sea level and water table depth.

preflabel: Concentration of organic matter in sediments
definition: Parameters quantifying the proportion of organic material in a soil or sediment sample

preflabel: Concentration of organic matter in the atmosphere
definition: Parameters quantifying uncategorised organic substance concentrations in atmospheric, generally aerosol, samples such as organic matter and DOC.
Parameters specifying the physical or chemical environment of a place where an organism is found.
Parameters specifying the vertical and horizontal spatial extent of the ecological character of a place where an organism is found
Parameters describing the causes and rate of mortality in cetaceans (Order Cetacea). Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.
Parameters relating to the abundance and nature of bacteria (Kingdom Monera) infecting other biota.

Parameters describing the actions or reactions of cetaceans (Order Cetacea), usually in response to the environment. Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.

Parameters describing the size, shape or physiological activity including disease and parasite infection status of cetaceans (Order Cetacea). Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.
Parameters describing rocks on the basis of physical characteristics such as colour, structure, mineralogy and grain size
Parameters relating to human built structures on the coast or offshore and their impact on the environment.
